snippet: Anton Stralman scored the opening goal in Game 5 against the Capitals on Monday and had a key role in the game-winner in overtime.
abstract: New York Rangers defenseman Anton Stralman scored the opening goal in Game 5 against Washington Capitals and had a key role in the game-winner in overtime. Photos, Chart (M)
lead_paragraph: Brad Richards's last-gasp goal in regulation, Marc Staal's overtime slap shot, Henrik Lundqvist's third-period save on a breakaway that tipped the crossbar. Those were the indelible images from one of the most thrilling victories in Rangers history, a 3-2 triumph over the Washington Capitals in Game 5 on Monday night at Madison Square Garden. None of them, perhaps, would have mattered if not for Anton Stralman.

headline.main: Would-Be Devil Has Become a Pivotal Ranger
